name.description: The name of this DC/OS service. Note that the executor type will be appended to this name.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to GitLab Runner.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to GitLab Runner.

instances.description: The number of GitLab Runner instances to start.

role.description: Deploy GitLab Runner only on nodes with this role.

one-instance-per-host.description: Only run one instance of GitLab Runner per DC/OS node.

service-name.description: The Mesos DNS service name, e.g. gitlab.marathon.mesos

registration-token.description: The registration token needed to be able to connect the GitLab Runners to the GitLab instance (available on GitLab -> Admin -> Runners).

executor.description: The executor type ("shell" or "docker" are supported). This is appended to the service name.

tag-list.description: A comma-separated list of tags. Those can be used in the CI job setting to pin build to specific runners having those tags.

concurrent-builds.description: The number of concurrent builds this runner should be able to run. This is bound to the resources this runner was given.

docker-default-image.description: Which Docker image should be used as default image for your builds. This is only relevant when using the 'docker' executor, and must be defined in that case.

docker-insecure-registry.description: If you want to use an insecure Docker registry, e.g. to push the built Docker images to or pull image from, you can add the hostname:port information here.
